metadata.Title: CVE-2019-11356 on Ubuntu 20.04 ESM (focal) - medium
metadata.Description:
The CalDAV feature in httpd in Cyrus IMAP 2.5.x through 2.5.12 and 3.0.xthrough 3.0.9 allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary code via acrafted HTTP PUT operation for an event with a long iCalendar propertyname.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-11356` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

cyrus-admin - 3.0.8-6
cyrus-caldav - 3.0.8-6
cyrus-clients - 3.0.8-6
cyrus-common - 3.0.8-6
cyrus-imapd - 3.0.8-6
cyrus-murder - 3.0.8-6
cyrus-nntpd - 3.0.8-6
cyrus-pop3d - 3.0.8-6
cyrus-replication - 3.0.8-6
libcyrus-imap-perl - 3.0.8-6
No subscription required

criterions.comment: cyrus-imapd package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '3.0.8-6').
